main event: The radar at Noblesville, Indiana detected 8 metallic, shiny objects on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were detected by ground radar and were observed for 2 hours.
The objects were described as round and shiny, appearing motionless at times.
The radar contact was intermittent, with the objects appearing to vanish and reappear.
The report was unable to conclusively identify the objects, listing them as possibly aircraft, balloons, or astronomical in nature.
The report includes details about the altitude and heading of the detected objects.
sighted object: 8 metallic, shiny objects detected on radar
